pr_title: [NETBEANS-4311]: Added support for auto-completion of Java Record

timeline.bodyText: Sorry, but I am not sure we should filter out j.l.Record here. We are not filtering any other element AFAIK, so why Record?
timeline.author: lahodaj

replies.bodyText: If I don't add the check , 'Record' entry need to be added in old golden files (roughly 65 files) otherwise existing test-cases will fail with nb-javac for 14
replies.author: arusinha

replies.bodyText: Sorry, I am unclear which files - the code completion tests run and pass on JDK 14 without nb-javac, the golden files have been updated some time ago. I believe files like ".../JavaCompletionTaskTest/14/initBlockTypesAndLocalMembers.pass" have been specifically added so that the tests would pass on JDK 14. Not sure if nb-javac should change anything here?
replies.author: lahodaj

replies.bodyText: java.lang.Record check is now removed. The problem was the in the proposed nb-javac-14 where it was added by mistake,corrected now
replies.author: arusinha

timeline.bodyText:
I am unsure about the "Record" here. This should be the golden file when the runtime platform is JDK 8. JDK 8 does not have j.l.Record, right?
(I would also suggest to minimize the number of golden outputs, if/as feasible.)
timeline.author: lahodaj

replies.author: arusinha

replies.bodyText: Sorry, but this does not match my understanding of how the tests are working. The content of the golden files is based on the runtime platfom - e.g. the content of java.lang. And when running on JDK 8, there is no java.lang.Record, correct? So when the completion will list all the content of java.lang, it is not clear to me where it would find out j.l.Record?
replies.author: lahodaj

replies.bodyText:
The check was not necessary, removed now
Also golden files are trimmed now
replies.author: arusinha

timeline.bodyText:
I think this method's name and content do not really match - it is not only "isRecordSupported", but also "and is the prefix a prefix of 'record''. I would suggest to drop the second concern from this method. Many callers don't need the prefix check. I counted just two callers that really need to check the prefix (for many, the prefix check happens automatically later), and I think it would be cleaner for them to call the prefix check explicitly.
Also, for discussion - should there be a preview enablement test here as well?
timeline.author: lahodaj

replies.bodyText:
Corrected the method signature now.
We are not using enable-preview flag to enable/disable text-block auto-completion. Propose to retain the same behavior. If someone types "rec" it will be auto completed to "record" . He/She can then use the enable-preview hint to add the required parameter
replies.author: arusinha

timeline.bodyText: The baseType parameter is unused. Suggest to either pass it to addTypes, or drop it.
timeline.author: lahodaj

replies.bodyText: thanks for correcting me, I will pass the parameter to to addTypes call
replies.author: arusinha

timeline.bodyText: I don't think we need the golden files that are the same for 1.8 and 10 and other versions, right? If the tests don't find the golden output for e.g. version 10, they should look for the golden output of older versions. I.e. it should be enough to specify a golden output for 1.8, and only re-specify it if it changes in a newer version.
timeline.author: lahodaj

replies.bodyText: Had reduced the golden files in last commit.
replies.author: arusinha

timeline.message: [NETBEANS-4311]: Added support for auto-completion of Java Record
[NETBEANS-4311]: Added support for auto-completion of Java Record
